Guoliang
Xing

Professor, IEEE Fellow, Department of Information Engineering
Director, CUHK AIoT Lab
Deputy Director, Centre for Innovation and Technology (CINTEC)
The Chinese University of Hong Kong
Email: glxing [@] cuhk.edu.hk
Rm 736, Ho Sin Hang Engineering Building,
CUHK, Shatin, NT, Hong Kong SAR



Professor Xing’s research lies at the intersection between systems, embedded AI, algorithms, and physical domains including health, autonomous driving, and environment. His research group develops new technologies at the frontier of mobile health, autonomous driving, Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS), Internet of Things (IoT), wireless networks, security and privacy. Several mobile technologies developed in his lab have been successfully transferred to the industry. Prof. Xing led the development of several large-scale systems for smart lampposts, Alzheimer’s Disease monitoring, and volcano monitoring. For details of his research, please visit the homepage of AIoT Lab. We are looking for motivated students and researchers to join us, see openings here.


News

Oct 2, 2023 Our paper “VI-Map: Infrastructure-Assisted Real-Time HD Mapping for Autonomous Driving” received Best Community Contribution Award at MobiCom 2023!
Jul 31, 2023 Co-Chairing CSP-IoT Week 2024 in Hong Kong! Please consider to submit papers.
Jul 30, 2023 Gave a keynote at ACM TURC (SigBed Symposium), and attended two panels.
Jul 25, 2023 Our paper “Enabling Ubiquitous WiFi Sensing with Beamforming Reports” was accepted by SIGCOMM 2023! Congrats to Chenhao and Xuan!
Jul 20, 2023 Serving on PC of MobiCom and SenSys 2024.
Jul 19, 2023 The Croucher ASI-AIoT Workshop just concluded. We had six distinguished lectures, four panels, and a dozen of invited talks!
Jun 22, 2023 Our paper “Mozart: A Mobile ToF System for Sensing in the Dark through Phase Manipulation” received the Best Paper Award at MobiSys 2023! Congrats to Zhiyuan and Xiaomin!
Feb 27, 2023 Two papers were accepted by MobiSys 2023!
Nov 9, 2022 Our poster “Aaron: Compile-time Kernel Adaptation for Multi-DNN Inference Acceleration on Edge GPU” received the Best Poster Award at by SenSys 2022! Congrats to Zhihe and Neiwen!
Nov 7, 2022 Our paper “BlastNet: Exploiting Duo-Blocks for Cross-Processor Real-Time DNN Inference” was selected as a Best Paper Finalist at SenSys 2022! Congrats to Neiwen!
Oct 18, 2022 Our paper “VIPS: Real-Time Perception Fusion for Infrastructure-Assisted Autonomous Driving” received Best Paper Award Runner-Up at MobiCom 2022! Congrats to Shuyao!
Sep 14, 2022 Three papers were accepted by SenSys 2022!
